title: Instant Pot Salsa Chicken Recipe
description: This salsa chicken Instant Pot recipe uses frozen chicken breasts rubbed with taco seasoning, then cooked in salsa and broth for an easy Tex-Mex meal.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Meat and Poultry Chicken Chicken Breast Instant Pot Salsa Chicken 4.8 (192) 149 Reviews 25 Photos This salsa chicken Instant Pot recipe makes an easy weeknight meal even easier. Frozen chicken breasts are combined with taco seasoning and salsa for a tasty Mexican-themed meal. You can use the meat for tacos, burrito bowls, or as a topping for baked potatoes. So many possibilities! I used this the first night for chicken quesadillas. The second night I used it as a topping for baked potatoes with shredded cheese, pickled jalapeños, and sour cream. Submitted by Tammy Lynn Updated on December 6, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 25 25 25 25 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 25 mins Additional Time: 20 mins Total Time: 50 mins Servings: 2 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 2 servings 1 pound frozen skinless, boneless chicken breast halves 1 (1 ounce) packet taco seasoning mix ½ cup salsa ½ cup low-sodium chicken broth Directions Place chicken breasts in a multi-functional cooker (such as Instant Pot). Sprinkle all sides with taco seasoning. Pour salsa and chicken broth on top. Close and lock the lid. Select Poultry setting; set the timer for 15 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build. Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 20 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid. Shred chicken and serve as desired. Buckwheat Queen Recipe Tips You can use water in place of chicken broth if desired.If you use thawed chicken breasts, shorten the cooking time to 8 to 10 minutes.Both quick-release and natural-release work for this recipe. I Made It Print 442 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Instant Pot Salsa Chicken 01 of 25 Photo by  Buckwheat Queen 02 of 25 Photo by  Brianna Woodham 06/12/2020 03 of 25 Photo by  Supernay 05/04/2020 04 of 25 Photo by  Christopher 03/18/2020 I made this per the recipe using McCormick Taco Seasoning and fresh salsa. Both my wife and I thought this was delicious. We’ll be making this again. Thank you. 05 of 25 Photo by  Kaitlyn White 02/04/2020 I keep almost everything the same, except I double the amount of salsa. Make sure you are pouring your sauce back into the chicken after you shred it because the chicken itself doesn’t take in much flavor. 06 of 25 Photo by  Hackmaster 07/23/2019 Great dish for Taco Tuesday! The only change that I made was I used a bottle of beer instead of chicken broth. I put the frozen breasts on the rack as other reviews mentioned so that the chicken wouldn't burn. I had leftover rice from Thai food 2 nights ago, so I made it into Mexican rice (added saffron, cumin, salt, pepper, and a bit of tomato paste). Served it with tortillas, guac, salsa, shredded cheese, and shredded lettuce. Delicious!!! 07 of 25 Photo by  Hackmaster 07/23/2019 Great dish for Taco Tuesday! The only change that I made was I used a bottle of beer instead of chicken broth. I put the frozen breasts on the rack as other reviews mentioned so that the chicken wouldn't burn. I had leftover rice from Thai food 2 nights ago, so I made it into Mexican rice (added saffron, cumin, salt, pepper, and a bit of tomato paste). Served it with tortillas, guac, salsa, shredded cheese, and shredded lettuce. Delicious!!! 08 of 25 Photo by  JustAGirlinMA 07/15/2019 Skipped the taco seasoning. Seasoned thawed chicken breasts with Lawry's seasoned salt and McCormick Italian & Herb blend. Put the chicken broth in first, then the seasoned breasts on the rack, then poured Tostitos Mild Splash of Lime chunky salsa on top. Set the Instapot to poultry and 15 minutes. Came out great! Paired with white rice. Will definitely make again, will try the taco seasoning next time to make tacos. 09 of 25 Photo by  Orbelina Flores 05/26/2019 I made this today in my Instapot. I did not have the other sauces....so I used what I had at home... 4 frozen chicken breasts. 1/1/2 cups of enchilada sause... 6 green California peppers (chopped) 1 red bell pepper (chopped) 5 garlic cloves (minced) 1 onion 1 cup water salt and pepper to taste.. I sauteed all vegetables.... then added the chicken on top and added sauce and water... Then, pressure cooked it for 20 minutes .... served it with Spanish white rice tostadas, and queso fresco Don Francisco. My family loved it... 10 of 25 Photo by  Orbelina Flores 05/26/2019 I made this today in my Instapot. I did not have the other sauces....so I used what I had at home... 4 frozen chicken breasts. 1/1/2 cups of enchilada sause... 6 green California peppers (chopped) 1 red bell pepper (chopped) 5 garlic cloves (minced) 1 onion 1 cup water salt and pepper to taste.. I sauteed all vegetables.... then added the chicken on top and added sauce and water... Then, pressure cooked it for 20 minutes .... served it with Spanish white rice tostadas, and queso fresco Don Francisco. name: Tammy Lynn
instructions: Place chicken breasts in a multi-functional cooker (such as Instant Pot). Sprinkle all sides with taco seasoning. Pour salsa and chicken broth on top.;Close and lock the lid. Select Poultry setting; set the timer for 15 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.;Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 20 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid.;Shred chicken and serve as desired. Buckwheat Queen
